As we could find out no XML files are generated in folder "C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\Messages\Data\SCCM.Inventory"

We noticed that despite of error message in SCCM workflow services are imported properly.

Could you help us to find the root cause of this error?

Thanks in advance

Table1.TaskTitle: Performance testing of Data Provider "Windows Server Inventory" improvement
Table1.TaskDescription:
New paramater introduced in DataGateway app.config: WindowsInventory.MaxDegreeOfParallelism
Number of parallel scans is determined by this value.
If it is 0 or 1 then scan should be performed sequentially.
Other value will define number of parallel scans. Values exceeding 1000 will be replaced with 1000.

We need to compare performance improvement for large number of computers in Inventory Configurations. E.g. 100 computer in sequential scan and in parallel with WindowsInventory.MaxDegreeOfParallelism = 100

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T131100 - #CIT03369 - Same entrys are present  twice in account xml
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.1.0.1651 - WPM 8.1

Hello,

on customer site it happens from time to time that the ldap import fails, because in the xml the same entry a present twice.
The only difference is the USNChanged value. See LDAP_import.xml.

How can this happen? The data collection takes about 20 minutes. The customer says that they don't have any kind of load balancing stuff, that 2 different DC may answering the request from our datagateway. (When this is somehow technical possible)
As long as we communication with one DC, we should make sure that the same SID is't present twice in XMl file.
Bug > datagateway does not check xml file
or do you want to analyze it?

 _______________

Installation:
=============

1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Perform an IISRESET

3. Stop the Windows Services
 - "Matrix42 Engine Common"
 - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
 - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
 - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

4. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

5. Copy the files
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.DataProcessing.Core.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Core\Matrix42.Services.Client.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
 
 into a separate backup directory

6. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

7. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28908_Hotfix.bat

8. Perform an IISRESET

9. Start the Windows Services
 - "Matrix42 Engine Common"
 - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
 - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
 - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

10. Check the functionality

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T131882 - VMWare inventory failing for ESXi servers on execution of Get-View TaskManager and Get-View eventManager
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hauner, Oliver
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

20-08-29 OHR:

Hi,

I have an escalated customer with a VMWare inventory problem.

Specifically the customer is inventorising 2 ESXi Servers in addition to several VCenters. With the VCenters everything works fine, but the 2 ESXi servers return an error. I have already installed the hotfix for PRB28179, but that does not help.

This is the error:

2016-08-24 21:35:34 INFO Processing computer ES-MAC-VH-0001
2016-08-24 21:35:34 INFO Processing VmWare environment on host ES-MAC-VH-0001...
2016-08-24 21:35:45 ERROR Error: VmWareVirtualInventoryProvider (ES-MAC-VH-0001) - Get-View : 24.08.2016 21:35:43    Get-View        View with Id  'TaskManager-TaskManager' was not found on the
server(s).   
At C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\DataGateway\Host\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\E
xtensions\Module\Matrix42.Virtualization.VmWare.ps1:82 char:12
+ $taskMgr = Get-View TaskManager
+            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (:) [Get-View], VimException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : Core_GetView_WriteNotFoundError,VMware.VimAutomation.ViCore.Cmdlets.Commands.DotNetInter
   op.GetVIView
 
Get-View : 24.08.2016 21:35:44    Get-View        View with Id  'eventManager-eventManager' was not found on the
server(s).   
At C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\DataGateway\Host\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\E
xtensions\Module\Matrix42.Virtualization.VmWare.ps1:83 char:13
+ $eventMgr = Get-View eventManager
+             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (:) [Get-View], VimException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : Core_GetView_WriteNotFoundError,VMware.VimAutomation.ViCore.Cmdlets.Commands.DotNetInter
   op.GetVIView
 
You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
At C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\DataGateway\Host\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\E
xtensions\Module\Matrix42.Virtualization.VmWare.ps1:90 char:1
+ $tCollector = Get-View ($taskMgr.CreateCollectorForTasks($tFilter))
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull
 
You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
At C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\DataGateway\Host\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\E
xtensions\Module\Matrix42.Virtualization.VmWare.ps1:93 char:1
+ $tasks = $tCollector.ReadNextTasks($tasknumber)
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull
 
You cannot call a method on a null-valued expression.
At C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\DataGateway\Host\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\E
xtensions\Module\Matrix42.Virtualization.VmWare.ps1:132 char:1
+ $tCollector.DestroyCollector()
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvokeMethodOnNull
 

2016-08-24 21:35:45 ERROR Error: VmWareVirtualInventoryProvider (ES-MAC-VH-0001) - Can not connect to vCenter ES-MAC-VH-0001. Please, make sure you have provided the correct vCenter name and user credentials. Check logs for details.

In the PS Script the commands Get-View TaskManager and Get-View eventManager are defined.
These are obviously part of the function "Get-M42VirtualVMWareVMotionHistor"

I tried to execute these commands from the PowerCLI console and got the same error.

I conclude that either some configuration is missing on the ESXi servers or that we are missing some kind of logic to automatically skip inventory of motion history if the VCenter server appears to be not a VCenter, but an ESXi server.

Please assist.

Kind regards,
Oliver

[Inquiry]: T132347 - Minimal permissions needed for Windows Inventory data provider
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hajzyk, Peter
Found in build: 8.1.0.1651 - WPM 8.1

Hi Peter,


we discussed min. permissions written in our online help last Friday by Skype:


[9/9/2016 3:47:45 PM | Edited 3:49:14 PM] Peter Hajzyk: this permissions should be set to user account which is located in Windows Inventory config

[9/9/2016 3:49:34 PM] Vyacheslav Khilko: yes, for defined user in the configuration or for account under which DG  is running

[9/9/2016 3:50:23 PM] Peter Hajzyk: the customer only wanted to know if this permissions above can be further reduced

[9/9/2016 3:50:36 PM] Vyacheslav Khilko: no

[9/9/2016 3:51:46 PM] Peter Hajzyk: ok, so I can say to customer that the permissions above are the minimal needed, right?

[9/9/2016 4:24:25 PM] Vyacheslav Khilko: yes


Best regards,

Vyacheslav!


Hi Team,

A customer asks what are the MINIMAL permissions needed for Windows Inventory to work properly.

It's not possible to put the user which is used in Windows Inventory to local Admin Group on Servers which have to be inventarised.

Customer has the internal policy to grant only minimal permissions needed to all systems.

Attached "Windows Inventory without local Admin permissions.docx" you can find the current customer permission settings but customer wants to know what can be reduced here so he has only to grant the minimal permissions possible to get Windows Inventory to run properly.

Thanks in advance

2016-09-09 PHK:

The named permissions from "helpfiles" page are known.
My questions was:
what are the MINIMAL (maximal reduced) permissions needed for getting Windows Inventory to work.
Can the permissions be further reduced or are these permissions from "helpfiles" link the maximal reduced?

Thanks

[ready] test Configure STS/Saml2 with Powershell
Table1.TaskDescription:
MAS: I added 3 cmdlets
get-WMSTS
gives you an object back describing the STS settings you normally do with config wizard

set-WMSTS
used to enable/disable STS

set-WMSTSAuthentication
used to change STS global security settings.
A small example script (the settings are garbage, to get a real saml2 login you must adjust it!):

$InstallerDirectory = "C:\dev\VSO\dev\Pandora\Root"

Import-Module "$InstallerDirectory\bin\Matrix42.Maintenance.Cmdlets.dll" -Force 

New-WMUpdateSession -InstallDir $InstallerDirectory

$ssOnUri = New-Object -TypeName "System.Uri" -ArgumentList "https://my.sso/logon"
$ssOutUri = New-Object -TypeName "System.Uri" -ArgumentList "https://my.sso/logout"

Set-WMSTSAuthentication -EnableSigleSignOn $false -EnableWindowsAuthentication $false -EnableSaml2Authentication $true -Saml2SingleSignOnUri $ssOnUri -Saml2SingleSignOutUri $ssOutUri -Saml2IdpIssuer "IdpIssuer" -Saml2SpIssuer "SpIssuer" -Saml2CertPublicKey "publicKey"
Table1.WiTitle: Configure STS/Saml2 with Powershell

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services

- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\LicensedItems.xml"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Run "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29009_hotfix.bat"

7. Perform an IISRESET

- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

9. Check the functionality

Problems which are fixed:

Table1.TaskTitle: Agentless data providers for virtualization inventory have option to skip creation of new computers
dev Give a possibility to disactivate Data Source in Layout Designer
Table1.WiTitle: Give a possibility to disactivate Data Source in Layout Designer
Table1.WiDescription:
For perforamnce reason Services calls need to be executed only when they really needed.

Example:
1. In Incident on loading or on changing an Initiator a bunch or services activated immediately. 
Like User History. But most likely this information even never be reviewed, as it displayed on hidden tab
it makes sense to bind availability of the DataSource to Selected Tab
2. In Incident a lot of request are required only when we create a New Incident, but have no sense on Editting. So, DataSource availabilty need to be bind to IsNew property

So when data source is disactive no request is sent, but on activation IF CURRENT state is outdated (input contract was changed previously but was not reloaded), then immeditely make request.

[Inquiry]: T132149 - Full Text Search in action Search Tasks doesn't show all expected results
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hajzyk, Peter
Found in build: 8.1.0.1637- WPM 8.1

Hi Team,

A customer found out that "Full Text" Search in action "Search Tasks" doesn't show all expected results.

For example if You create a Task with summary "Task ohne Beschreibung" and without decription and search via "Search Tasks" in field "Full Text" after the keyword "ohne" than created Task "Task ohne Beschreibung" cannot be found but it contains the word "ohne" in the Summary.
If you search for word "ohne" in field "Subject" than the Task can be found properly.

Can You tell us why the Full Text Search behaves like that?

Thanks in advance

=============

1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

   manually and leave one computer from each duplicates group only.

5. Open file "Remove fragment duplicates imported from SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database. 
   Execute the script. 

6. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common" 
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" 
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"

  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.DataProcessing.Core.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
 
 into a separate backup directory

9. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

10. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28908_Hotfix.bat

11. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29021_Hotfix.bat

12. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28758_PRB28774_Hotfix.bat

13. Perform an IISRESET

14. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common" 
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" 
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

15. Enable SCCM Inventory Provider.

16. Check the functionality. 

17. Activate SCCM Inventory Provider and Check GDIE logs after it is completed.

[Inquiry]: T132865 - Service Store UI freezes for all users - different blocking SQL queries each time
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hauner, Oliver
Found in build: 8.1.0.1651 - WPM 8.1

2016-09-09 OHR:

Hi,

at Carl Zeiss we have the following issue since their update from 8.0.1 to 8.1.0:

Service Store crashes periodically and the UI freezes for all users. To recover the application the Engine Common Service needs to be restarted.

On the SQL server blockings have been identified in each case, however I analysed the results and could not find any common cause for each crash. We seem to have different queries blocking other queries each time, so probably optmisation of SQL queries does not seem to be the way to here.

Queries used for analysis as well as the results, see attachments.

We urgently need assistance with identifying the cause and fixing this.

Kind regards,
Oliver

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.0.1651 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which is fixed:
- PRB28758 - SCCM Data Provider sometimes creates duplicates of computer records, inspite of complete information in XML files and unique machine IDs
- PRB28908: Runtime of SCCM import takes to long - Import of huge environtments not possible
- PRB28943: LDAP Data Provider fails when collected data exceeds 28MB of volume
- PRB29018: SCCM Data Provider cannot import from SCCM 2007
- PRB29021 - Error Message in SCCM Dataprovider - Object reference not set to an instance of an object

Installation:
=============

1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Perform an IISRESET

3. Disable SCCM Inventory Provider.

4. Open file "Get duplicates of computers managed by SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database.
   Execute the script. You will get a list of computers imported twice or more times from SCCM ( having the same name ). You should remove these duplicates from M42 Application
   manually and leave one computer from each duplicates group only.

5. Open file "Remove fragment duplicates imported from SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database.
   Execute the script.

6. Stop the Windows Services
 - "Matrix42 Engine Common"
 - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
 - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
 - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

7. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

8. Copy the files

  "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2007.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2012.Connector.dll"


  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Core\Matrix42.Services.Client.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.SCCM2007.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.SCCM2012.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.DataProcessing.Core.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll" 
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2007.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2012.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
 
 into a separate backup directory

9. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

10. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28908_Hotfix.bat

11. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29021_Hotfix.bat

12. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28758_PRB28774_Hotfix.bat

13. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\DisableHistory.bat

14. Perform an IISRESET

15. Start the Windows Services
 - "Matrix42 Engine Common"
 - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
 - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
 - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

16. Enable SCCM Inventory Provider.

17. Check the functionality.

Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.0.0.1478 - WPM2015

Customer has to move his database to an sql2016 this weekend and because of this he also try's to update the system to 8.1. The wizard fails with this error:
2016-09-12 08:25:48,731 ERROR 1 Matrix42.Setup (null) (null) (null)  (null) 8.1.0.1651   - update4u.SPS.DataLayer.SPSDataEngineException: Fehler beim Initialisieren der SPSDataEngine ---> System.ArgumentException: The DataTableMapping is already contained by another DataTableMappingCollection.

   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.Persistence.Connector.Sql.SqlConnectorBase.FillDataSet(SqlCommand selectCommand, DataSet result, List`1 connectorMappings, SPSParameterCollection spsParameters)
   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.Persistence.Connector.Sql.SqlConnectorBase.FillDataSet(String sqlText, DataSet result, List`1 connectorMappings, SPSParameterCollection spsParameters)

   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.Schema.Internal.SchemaManager.SchemaLoad(SPSTransaction outerTransaction, ObjectClass basicSchemaClass)
   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.Schema.Internal.SchemaManager.BuildSchema(SPSTransaction outerTransaction)
   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.SPSDataEngine.StartBaseSchema(SPSTransaction outerTransaction)
   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.SPSDataEngine.ReInitialize(SPSTransaction outerTransaction)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at update4u.SPS.DataLayer.SPSDataEngine.ReInitialize(SPSTransaction outerTransaction)

This update problem must be analyzed until saturday, where the database should be moved > we need a remote session.

I guess it is a topic for MAS,
We asked the customer to send us the result of the following query:

select count(*)

from SchemaDataTable

where StoredInSchemaDataConnector not in (select ID from SchemaDataConnector where name ='SchemaConnector')

Feedback will be given tomorrow for this query.

2016-09-15 14:53:09 INFO Processing computer VTSSCI01
2016-09-15 14:53:10 INFO Unix Inventory (VTSSCI01): getting inventory...

Oliver

2016-10-11 DSH:
I checked. All fixes had been included into 8.0.X, and Main branches.
So it needs to be tested.

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.0.2.1580 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28172: Windows Inventory does not recognise deinstallation of SQL Server
- PRB28116: Inventory Data Providers use <hostname.FQDN> instead of actual DNS Name to address servers
- PRB28880: HyperV inventory of a cluster does not import host/guest relation
- PRB28881: Dataprovider Inventory of Citrix XenServer does not import the correct host server for guest systems
- PRB29052: Wrong naming for SPSComputerClassBase.Processor with inventory data providers.

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Perform an IISRESET
 
3. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

4. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

5. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Inventory.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Inventory.Contracts.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.ServerCompliance.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Inventory.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Inventory.Contracts.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Matrix42.DataProvider.Contracts.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Matrix42.Inventory.Contracts.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Matrix42.DataProvider.AppicationInventory.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Matrix42.DataProvider.Contracts.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Matrix42.Inventory.Contracts.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Matrix42.VirtualInventory.DataProvider.HyperV.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Matrix42.VirtualInventory.DataProvider.VMWare.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Matrix42.VirtualInventory.DataProvider.XenServer.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Module\Matrix42.Inventory.Connection.ps1"
  into a separate backup directory

6. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

7. Perform an IISRESET
 
8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"


9. Check the functionality

Table1.TaskTitle: PRB29072: usp_LCM_RecalculateLicenseDemandServerStatistics runs synchronously with devastating impact on performance

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28898: Partial license transfer in scenarios with maintenance and license conversion makes remaining licenses invalid
- PRB29009: Unix Provider is not able to scan AIX unix systems
- PRB28878: License demand statistics not recalculated in some scenarios
- PRB29072: usp_LCM_RecalculateLicenseDemandServerStatistics runs synchronously with devastating impact on performance
 
Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\LicensedItems.xml"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Run "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29009_hotfix.bat"

7. Perform an IISRESET
 
8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

9. Check the functionality

Table1.TaskDescription: Done in #78807
Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.0.1651 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which is fixed:
- PRB28758 - SCCM Data Provider sometimes creates duplicates of computer records, inspite of complete information in XML files and unique machine IDs
- PRB28908: Runtime of SCCM import takes to long - Import of huge environtments not possible
- PRB28943: LDAP Data Provider fails when collected data exceeds 28MB of volume
- PRB29018: SCCM Data Provider cannot import from SCCM 2007
- PRB29021 - Error Message in SCCM Dataprovider - Object reference not set to an instance of an object

Installation:
=============

1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Perform an IISRESET

3. Disable SCCM Inventory Provider.

4. Open file "Get duplicates of computers managed by SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database.
   Execute the script. You will get a list of computers imported twice or more times from SCCM ( having the same name ). You should remove these duplicates from M42 Application
   manually and leave one computer from each duplicates group only.

5. Open file "Remove fragment duplicates imported from SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database.
   Execute the script.

6. Stop the Windows Services
 - "Matrix42 Engine Common"
 - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
 - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
 - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

7. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

8. Copy the files

  "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2007.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2012.Connector.dll"


  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Core\Matrix42.Services.Client.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.SCCM2007.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.SCCM2012.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.DataProcessing.Core.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll" 
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2007.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.SCCM2012.Connector.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.AssetManager.BizLogic.dll"
 
 into a separate backup directory

9. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

10. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28908_Hotfix.bat

11. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29021_Hotfix.bat

12. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28758_PRB28774_Hotfix.bat

13. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\DisableHistory.bat

14. Perform an IISRESET

15. Start the Windows Services
 - "Matrix42 Engine Common"
 - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
 - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
 - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

16. Enable SCCM Inventory Provider.

17. Check the functionality.

Found in build: 8.1.1.1674 - WPM 8.1.1

Customer can't publish Workflows. No matter if they are freshley created or imported from another system. The workflow Studio Feedbacks that the Publishing was successfull but the state of the workflows immediately sets back to ready for publish.

Which logfiles can help analyzing this case?

added debug and datalayer profiling logs.

"web deployment Agent Service" is set to active and automatic.

No Windows Event Logs for 'Web Deployment Service' available.

I've reinstalled Web Deploy, which had no effect at all. But somehow, the IIS doesn't answer to http://127.0.0.1:80 requests.

Maybe the issue is related to https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/954874

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.0.2.1580 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28184: High CPU load while running SCCM/EM provisioning workflows
- PRB28321: Not possible to remove License Custodian
- PRB28378: LIS online update fails caused by [ symbol
- PRB28334: LIS Update fails with a deadlock Process ID 250
- PRB28538: Change of License Model for existing License Requirement can cause UI freeze
- PRB28568: reenabling of option in "set license pool" dialog
- PRB28651: LIS update NULL reference while step 1/10
- PRB28707: Partial license transfer with previous license conversion splits base licenses incorrectly
- PRB28693: Demand count inconsistent after changing Software Product in license demand
- PRB28760: Creation of license demand based on AD group memberships may sometimes fail due to SQL queries being blocked
- PRB28898: Partial license transfer in scenarios with maintenance and license conversion makes remaining licenses invalid
- PRB29006: recalculation of LRQs (with inconsistent count) count for a all found LRQs will be processed at once, it must be done proportionally
- PRB29009: Unix Provider is not able to scan AIX unix systems
- PRB28966: Oracle feature usage import only imports partially by second passing
- PRB28591: License Demand quantity is no longer calculated automatically after License Model change
- PRB29072: usp_LCM_RecalculateLicenseDemandServerStatistics runs synchronously with devastating impact on performance

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.WorkProcess.Core.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.WorkProcess.Core.dll"
 
 "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.WebUI.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\Matrix42.WorkProcess.Core.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\de\update4u.LicenseManager.WebUI.resources.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\LicenseManager\Wizards\LeaseLicense\ActionPage.ascx"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\DlgControls\LicenseManager\SPSAssetTypeLicense\LicensePool.ascx"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\DlgControls\LicenseManager\LCMLicenseDemandType\General.ascx"
  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Run 
"<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28538PRB28568PRB29006_hotfix.bat"
"<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29009_hotfix.bat"
"<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28591_hotfix.bat"

7. Perform an IISRESET
 
8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

9. Check the functionality

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note: 
=============== 
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions! 
Problems which are fixed: 

PRB29060: During migration from SQL2008R2 to 2012 or higher the internal DataLayer migration for the autonumber mechanic to sequences can crash

Installation: 
============= 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account. 

2. Perform an IISRESET 

3. Stop the Windows Services 
- "Matrix42 Engine Common" 
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" 
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler" 

4. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store 
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store" 

5. Copy the files: 
"\bin\update4u.SPS.DataLayer.dll"
"\web\bin\update4u.SPS.DataLayer.dll"
"\svc\bin\update4u.SPS.DataLayer.dll"
into a separate backup directory 

6. Copy the attached folders to "<InstallationFolder>"

7. Perform an IISRESET 

8. Start the Windows Services 
- "Matrix42 Engine Common" 
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" 
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler" 

9. Check the functionality

Table1.TaskTitle: PRB29069: SQL Statement from LCM module causes blockings - needs optimising
Table1.WiTitle: PRB29069: SQL Statement from LCM module causes blockings - needs optimising

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28898: Partial license transfer in scenarios with maintenance and license conversion makes remaining licenses invalid
- PRB29009: Unix Provider is not able to scan AIX unix systems
- PRB28878: License demand statistics not recalculated in some scenarios
- PRB29072: usp_LCM_RecalculateLicenseDemandServerStatistics runs synchronously with devastating impact on performance
- PRB29069: SQL Statement from LCM module causes blockings - needs optimising 

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\LicensedItems.xml"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.Engine.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Run 
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29009_hotfix.bat"
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29069_hotfix.bat"

7. Perform an IISRESET
 
8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

9. Check the functionality

[Inquiry]: T132574 - Workflow engine workflow run into faulted state / message is closed error while ldap is running.
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

Hello,

please see attached services.log.

From time to time the workflow engine does not work until they restart the hole system. This happens the most times at night.
In the attached log files the scan at 23:xx was the last succesfull scan, after that no workflow was started anymore till the reboot at morning.

Any idea whats could be wrong there?
Currently it is an 2008R2 Server with .Net 4.6 and powershell 5.0.

The customer will update to 8.1.2 in 2 weeks. So if you may have known issues in 8.0.2 which could be the reason please tell me if they are fixed in 8.1.2 or not.

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T129831 - Servicespezifisches Formular kann in einem Bundle nicht ausgefüllt werden, wenn auf zielbereitstellenden Service gewartet werden soll
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Konietzny, Beatrice
Found in build: 8.1.0.1651 - WPM 8.1

Hi, does anyone have an idea?

If in a bundle the "Provisioning Service" used, a service-specific form of the waiting service no longer be filled. And the customer will receive an error message when ordering (attachment: 07_warenkorb_FehlerAbsenden)

Together with Michael Abel I looked at the configuration at the customer, we could not find something wrong. Here also the logs.
In our test system, I have the "Provisioning Service" also used in a bundle. Both forms are offered to me to fill. I can not reproduce the error.
The customers documents include no specials.
 

Picture 01_ServiceADAccountBereitstellen shows: Target Ready Stellender Service (Created an AD account)

Picture 02_ServiceMailPostfachbestellen shows: Service with technical target "ADAccount"

Picture 03_BundleKonfiguration_Mailpostfachbestellen shows configuration in bundle

Picture 04_Portal_KonfigurationBundle shows: Representation of the bundles in the portal

Picture 05_Portal_zusatzinfoADAccountbereitstellen shows: only the additional information of the target-providing services queried

Picture 06_Portal_WarenkorbBundle shows: In the cart does not appear that also the other service additional information needed

Picture 06a_Portal_WarenkorbBundleMitEinzelService shows: will be ordered individually this service, the information is retrieved and displayed

Picture 07_Warenkorb_FehlerAbsenden shows: Error message in the portal for sending the basket

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28898: Partial license transfer in scenarios with maintenance and license conversion makes remaining licenses invalid
- PRB29009: Unix Provider is not able to scan AIX unix systems
- PRB28878: License demand statistics not recalculated in some scenarios
- PRB29072: usp_LCM_RecalculateLicenseDemandServerStatistics runs synchronously with devastating impact on performance
- PRB29069: SQL Statement from LCM module causes blockings - needs optimising 
- PRB29087: In License conversion the conversion factor is ignored when base license has computers in "System Restriction"

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\LicensedItems.xml"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\Web\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.Engine.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.BizLogic.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

 "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Common.dll"

  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Run 
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29009_hotfix.bat"
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB29069_hotfix.bat"

7. Perform an IISRESET
 
8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

9. Check the functionality

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions!

Problems which are fixed: PRB29088: VMWare Data Provider cannot import free VSphere/ESXi environments - views "Get-View-TaskManager" and "Get-View-EventManager" missing on server.

Prerequisities

Installation:
=============
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Perform an IISRESET

3. Stop the Windows Services - "Matrix42 Engine Common" - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler" - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

4. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

5. Copy the file: "\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Module\Matrix42.Virtualization.VmWare.ps1 " into a separate backup directory

6. Copy the file from the attached zip file to "\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Inventory\Extensions\Module\"

7. Perform an IISRESET

8. clear browser cache (temprorary internet files)

9. Start the Windows Services - "Matrix42 Engine Common" - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler" - "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

10. Check the functionality

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T133855 - Formsauthentication fails with NullReferenceException
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.0.0.1478 - WPM2015

Hello,

on a customer system, windows authentication works fine, but the forms authentication does not work.
When a user enters credentials and clicks on login, the message shows "username /pw incorrect"
No error in security.console.log but in console.log

016-09-27 12:10:30,785 INFO 65 Console (null) (null) (null)  (null) 8.0.0.1478   - System.NullReferenceException: Der Objektverweis wurde nicht auf eine Objektinstanz festgelegt.
   bei System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapType.FilterBin64(String value)
   bei System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapHexBinary.Parse(String value)
   bei PWDTK_DOTNET451.PWDTK.HashHexStringToBytes(String hashHexString)
   bei Matrix42.Services.Security.Accounts.PasswordHasher.IsValidPassword(String hexSalt, String hexHash, String password)
   bei Matrix42.Services.Security.Accounts.CredentialsValidator.ValidateInternalAccountPassword(String password, String hash, String salt)
   bei Matrix42.Services.Security.Accounts.LoginValidationManager.AccountHasAccess(AccountInfo accountInfo, String fullUserName, String password)
   bei Matrix42.Services.Security.Accounts.LoginValidationManager.Validate(String fullUserName, String password)
   bei Matrix42.Services.Security.M42MembershipProvider.ValidateUser(String username, String password)

Do you have any ideas to this error, what we can do?

.Net Cache was cleared
I force the customer now to install latest windows updates and .net 4.6. because the error ends up in system components, which are not delivered from us.

Any other ideas?

Thanks

Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

Hello,

opening a dialog fails with this error:
2016-10-05 14:33:44,104 ERROR 17 Console (null) (null) (null)  (null) 8.0.2.1580   - Cannot load type 'Matrix42.Administration.Engine.RevertObjectController, Matrix42.Administration.Engine'.
System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingException: Cannot load type 'Matrix42.Administration.Engine.RevertObjectController, Matrix42.Administration.Engine'.

Server stack trace:
   at System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingConfigHandler.RemotingConfigInfo.LoadType(String typeName, String assemblyName)
   at System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingConfigHandler.RemotingConfigInfo.GetServerTypeForUri(String URI)
   at System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingServices.GetServerTypeForUri(String URI)
   at System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BinaryServerFormatterSink.ProcessMessage(IServerChannelSinkStack sinkStack, IMessage requestMsg, ITransportHeaders requestHeaders, Stream requestStream, IMessage& responseMsg, ITransportHeaders& responseHeaders, Stream& responseStream)

Exception rethrown at [0]:
   at System.Runtime.Remoting.Proxies.RealProxy.HandleReturnMessage(IMessage reqMsg, IMessage retMsg)
   at System.Runtime.Remoting.Proxies.RealProxy.PrivateInvoke(MessageData& msgData, Int32 type)
   at update4u.SPS.Engines.IRemoteEngine.GetWorker(WorkerIniParms initialParms)
   at update4u.SPS.Engines.EngineProxy.GetWorker(String registeredInterface, Type workerInterface, Object[] constructorArgs)
   at update4u.SPS.Engines.EngineProxy.GetWorker(Type workerInterface)
   at update4u.SPS.WebUI.Components.Controls.Dialogs.PropertyDialogs.DialogContentContainer.IsObjectRevertable(Guid typeId, Guid objectId)

_____________________________
It looks like a typical message for "hostcommon service is not running", but all services are running.
Ports via netstat -ano are not blocked by other services
the mentioned dll is present under \bin and \web\bin and is not blocked.
Trend micro (virus scanner) was disabled in my request
Firewall is offline
i already reinstalled the services after disabling the virus scanner.

The error is still present. Do you have any idea whats could be wrong here?

Table1.TaskTitle: test [ready] [Hotfix]: Hotfix_8.1.2.1712_20160921 - PRB29081

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions! 
Problems which are fixed: 
PRB28784: Copy and Paste of images in Self Service Portal is not possible with IE11

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.
 
2. Perform an IISRESET
 
3. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"
 
4. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"
 
5. Copy the files:

"<Installationfolder>\Web\Portal\Controls\ContentEditableDiv.js"

into a separate backup directory
 
6. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

7. Perform an IISRESET

8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"
 
9. Clear browser cache

10. Check the functionality

Table1.TaskTitle: PRB29097: Software Compliance dows not calculate available usage rights correctly

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.1.1674 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB29097: Software Compliance does not calculate available usage rights correctly
 
Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

3. Copy the files:
"<Installationfolder>\Config\Analysis\u4udw.xmla" 
"<Installationfolder>\Reports\SSRS\EN\License Manager\Software Compliance.rdl"
"<Installationfolder>\Reports\SSRS\EN\License Manager\by Cost Center\Software Compliance.rdl"
"<Installationfolder>\Reports\SSRS\EN\License Manager\by Location\Software Compliance.rdl"
"<Installationfolder>\Reports\SSRS\DE\License Manager\Softwarekonformität.rdl"
"<Installationfolder>\Reports\SSRS\DE\License Manager\nach Kostenstelle\Softwarekonformität.rdl"
"<Installationfolder>\Reports\SSRS\DE\License Manager\nach Standort\Softwarekonformität.rdl"
   into a separate backup directory

4. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

5. Open in SQL Management Studio 
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\Warehouse\Table_Add_SharedLicenses.sql" 
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\Warehouse\Update_SPs_LicenseAssignment_LicenseDowngrade.sql" scripts,
   replace there "[U4UWarehouse]" database alias on real warehouse database name & [U4USUITE] database alias on real Service Store database name, execute the script

6. Run Configuration Wizard, perform Change Configuration -> Configure Analysis & Reporting Services 
      -> check options "Recreate Data Warehouse Cube" & "Redeploy Reports" (only these 2 options) -> complete configuration

7. Run "License Management - Update Reporting Data Warehouse" engine activation

8. Check the functionality

Table1.WiTitle: Pandora Shell: Tracking long-running asynchronous actions running in background
Table1.WiDescription:
Very often Actions initiated in Pandora UI are long running and cannot be finished within request time.
Such actions need to be executed asynchronously.

Pandora Shell need provide an UI for tracking such processes.
Depending on Action type the tracking panel can vary:
1. Just show current Status: In Progress, Fail, Success
2.  + support Cancellation - possibility to stop execution
3.  + Support progress bar

When the Process is finished, immediately show Notification bar with result

Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.2.1712 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28976: Confirmation of consolidated license demand is reset after switching host
- PRB29087: In License conversion the conversion factor is ignored when base license has computers in "System Restriction"

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\update4u.LicenseManager.BizLogic.dll"

  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Run 
- "<InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28976_hotfix.bat"

7. Perform an IISRESET
 
8. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

9. Check the functionality

   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper..ctor(Int32 classStyle, Int32 style, Int32 exStyle, Int32 x, Int32 y, Int32 width, Int32 height, String name, IntPtr parent, HwndWrapperHook[] hooks)
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher..ctor()

   at System.Windows.Media.DoubleCollection..ctor()
   at Telerik.Windows.Documents.UI.TextDecorations.DecorationProviders.UnderlineTypes..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at Telerik.Windows.Documents.Model.Span..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at Matrix42.Workflows.Activities.ObjectReferenceProcessor.SetTextPlaceholders(String text, String activityPropertyName, Int32 culture)
   at Matrix42.Workflows.Activities.ObjectReferenceProcessor.GenerateFinalHtml(String rawHtml, Int32 culture, String activityPropertyName, Boolean getPlainText)

dev PRB28867: Provisioning Workflow "Provisioning - Assign AD group" triggers LDAP CoRu "LDAP Synchronize Existing Group"
Table1.TaskDescription:
2016-11-09 PBI: work as disigned. CoRu will trigger sync WF and it's OK. This WF will not change any data. The only one reason why member can be removed it the following scenario:
1. Import started
2. Read group members without new member
3. Provisioning WF executed - new member added to Group
4. Group importing - removing newly added member because it is absent in import data

This can explain why it can happen but very rarely. Currently we cannot change this behavior because import has priority during sync conflicts.

Table1.TaskTitle: PRB29133: Config Wizard: "Change Database Server" does not remove all entry to the old database for workflow engine

Table1.TaskDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.2.1712 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
PRB29133: Config Wizard: "Change Database Server" does not remove all entry to the old database for workflow engine
 
Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.
 
2. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"
 
3. Copy the files:
"<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Setup.Pages.dll"

into a separate backup directory
 
4. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

5. Run "SQL server Management Studio" on the old SQL server instance

7. Go to "SQL Server Agent" Jobs node

8. Delete Old Monitoring jobs
"Microsoft_ApplicationServer_Monitoring_AutoPurge_<OldMonitoringDatabaseName>"
"Microsoft_ApplicationServer_Monitoring_ImportTransferEvents_<OldMonitoringDatabaseName>"
"Microsoft_ApplicationServer_Monitoring_ImportWcfEvents_<OldMonitoringDatabaseName>"
"Microsoft_ApplicationServer_Monitoring_ImportWfEvents_<OldMonitoringDatabaseName>"

9. Run Configuration Wizard -> Configure Service Layer

10. Start "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager"

11. Go to Sites>Default Web Site>M42Services

12. Check if on a right panel (Actions) Manage WCF and WF Services section "Start Application" action is disabled (greyed out)
if it is green and available to click, please click it, it should start our service layer
 
13. Check SQL server logs

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T135064 Magna  System Outage > IIS delivers error 500 because of workflow engine?
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

Please see attached log files. Magna reported that yesterday 19.10 at 9.00 pm CET their service store had another outage. This time it seems not related to the SQL server and blockings, because at this time the IIS simply delivered error 500 directly.

When we look at the logs that service layer delivers at 15:35  a first error and than the workflow run into faulted state, register again > faultet state and so on.

What are the next step for analyzing topics?

Please note that the change manahement error at 15:35 is a side effect of hotfix  ​Hotfix_8.0.2.1580_20160816 - PRB28339 PRB28017 PRB28444 PRB28650 PRB28789 PRB28095

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T129958 - Rhenus Removing Collateral Requirement may shutdown the hole system
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Bönick, Matthias
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

Rhenus reported already under 7.0.1 that removing collateral requirement was a reason for a 30 minute outage in their system.
About 9000 LRQ where deleted in this process, recalulation for other requirements to.

Rhenus says that the reason is, that we are doing this in one big transaction.
IN the attachments there are some queries visible and screenshots from the product, where they had these changes.

Please try to reproduce this in the rhenus performance lab, where LCM data is present. Support does not have that big amount of data.

IF you are not able to reproduce this topic, because no LCM data is available anymore:

Can you tell us anything about the mentioned topic > deletion process is executed in one big transaction and has the potential to block the hole system?
Is this possible or not? What mechanics are implemented to avoid such happening?

Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.2.1712 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed: PRB29150 - #LMIN10814 - WPM 8.1.2 - Aktion Konto entsperren - Fehler "...nicht serialisierbar".

Installation:
=============
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.
2. Perform an IISRESET
3. Stop the Windows Services - "Matrix42 Engine Common" - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
4. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

5. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\host.config"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.STS.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.STS.Web.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Microsoft.Owin.Security.OAuth.dll"
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\System.Web.Mvc.dll"
 into a separate backup directory

6. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"
7. Perform an IISRESET
8. clear browser cache (temprorary internet files)
9. Start the Windows Services - "Matrix42 Engine Common" - "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86" - "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
10. Check the functionality.

Table1.WiTitle: Inquiry T128368  Berichte funktionieren nicht mehr
Table1.WiDescription:
While opening the Reports 'Customer Satisfaction - Incidents', 'Customer Satisfaction - Knowledge Base' and 'Overview List Tickets' an error occurs. 'The report can't be loaded' is the message and in the Logfile:

'An error occurred during report rendering: Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.Internal.Soap.ReportingServices2005.Execution.RSExecutionConnection+MissingEndpointException: The attempt to connect to the report server failed.  Check your connection information and that the report server is a compatible version. ---> System.InvalidOperationException: Error in XML-File (1,10836). ---> System.Xml.XmlException: '', hexidecimal value 0x1F, is an invalid sign. line 1, position 10836.'

Customer send a backup of the database, I embedded it into my test system and tried to find the hex sign with queries like.

'SELECT TicketNumber, Description, DescriptionHTML, Subject
FROM SPSActivityClassBase 
WHERE CHARINDEX(CHAR(0x1F), DescriptionHTML) > 0'

and

'SELECT
    TicketNumber
    ,CHARINDEX(0x1F, CAST(TicketNumber AS varbinary(30))),TicketNumber
FROM SPSActivityClassBase
WHERE
    CHARINDEX(0x1F, CAST(TicketNumber AS varbinary(30))) > 0;'

But I wasn't able to find the hex sign to delete it. I currently need someone to take a look at it.

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.2.1712 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB29156: SCCM API call has to be adjusted

Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

3. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

4. Copy the files:
 "<Installationfolder>\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"
 
 "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"
 
 "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"
 
  into a separate backup directory

5. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

6. Perform an IISRESET
 
7. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

8. Check the functionality

Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.0.1637 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
- PRB28758: SCCM Data Provider sometimes creates duplicates of computer records, inspite of complete information in XML files and unique machine IDs
- PRB28774: SCCM imports wrong number of CPU sockets
- PRB29156: SCCM API call has to be adjusted
 
Installation:
=============
 
1. Log on to the Matrix42 Service Store webserver using an administrative account.

2. Disable SCCM Inventory Provider.

3. Open file "Get duplicates of computers managed by SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database. 
   Execute the script. You will get a list of computers imported twice or more times from SCCM ( having the same name ). You should remove these duplicates from M42 Application
   manually and leave one computer from each duplicates group only.

4. Open file "Remove fragment duplicates imported from SCCM.sql" in MS SQl Server Management Studio and connect to the M42Database. 
   Execute the script. 

5. Stop the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

6. With Windows Explorer, open the installation directory of Matrix42 Service Store
   e.g. "C:\Program Files\Matrix42\Matrix42 Service Store"

7. Copy the files 
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\svc\bin\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\DataGateway\Apps\Matrix42.DataGateway.Workflow\Activities\Matrix42.Connectors.EmSccm.Client.dll"

  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.dll"
  "<Installationfolder>\ServiceRepository\BinaryComponents\Matrix42.Connectors.Activities.Design.dll"
 
 into a separate backup directory

8. Copy the attached folders to "<Installationfolder>"

9. Run <InstallationFolder>\Config\PRB28758_PRB28774_Hotfix.bat


10. Perform an IISRESET
 
11. Start the Windows Services
- "Matrix42 Engine Common"
- "Matrix42 Engine CommonX86"
- "Matrix42 Engine Scheduler"
- "Matrix42 Data Gateway"

12. Enable SCCM Inventory Provider.

13. Check the functionality. 

14. Activate SCCM Inventory Provider and Check GDIE logs after it is completed.

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T134660 - Matrix Update to 8.1.2.1712 fails - wrong space allocation for backup calculated
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hajzyk, Peter
Found in build: 8.1.2.1712 - WPM 8.1.2

Hi Team,

a customer tries to update his System from Version 8.1.0 to 8.1.2.1712 and gets wrong information regarding space allocation for backup of application folder.
Customer checked the size of application folder in Windows Explorer and it's 8,5GB, see attachment "Speicherplatz Explorer.PNG". Setup Wizard says that 143GB is needed for backup and throws an error, see attached screenshot "Speicherplatz Installation.PNG".

Can You help us to determine what causes this wrong calculated size for backup of application folder? How it's calculated?

Thanks in advance.

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T135469 - Exchange Features not found by Windows Inventory
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hauner, Oliver
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

2016-10-26 OHR:

Hi,

a customer is using Windows Inventory, which runs successfully, but on the Exchange Servers (Exchange 2010) no Exchange features can be found. There are various Exchange installation records from Empirum but no a single Exchange Fingerprint from Windows Inventory.

I replaced the customer's Exchange PS script with the one from our 8.0.3 test lab (attached), but this did not help. For some reason the PS script is not finding the Exchange features and there are no errors that indicate a technical cause.

Please assist.

Kind regards,
Oliver

+++++++++++

2017-01-09 OHR:

Hi,

the customer executed the script and it resulted in this:

Cannot index into a null array.
At line:13 char:40
+             $majorVersion = $($matches[ <<<< 1])
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (1:Int32) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NullArray

Cannot index into a null array.
At line:14 char:40
+             $minorVersion = $($matches[ <<<< 2])
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (2:Int32) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NullArray

Cannot index into a null array.
At line:15 char:43
+             $revisionVersion = $($matches[ <<<< 3])
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (3:Int32) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NullArray

Microsoft Exchange Server Unknown

If the customer changes the line $exchServer = Get-ExchangeServer to $exchServer = Get-ExchangeServer "test1" ("test1" being the name of the Exchange Server) it returns „Microsoft Exchange Server 2010“.

However the problem still remains the same:

The Exchange Server features are still not being inventorised and it seems this issue is customer-specific. We understand that there can be Empirum Fingerprints with identical names, but for the Exchanges featuresthere surely won't be because Empirum cannot inventorise Exchange features.

Kind regards,
Oliver

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T134947 - Status von Bestellungen wird nicht aktualisiert
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Schenten, Kevin
Found in build: 8.1.0.1637- WPM 8.1

Hi,

the customer has a problem with their SCCM installations triggered by Service Store. Both Workflows, Change and Provisioning, start and wait for the closure of the change. Somehow, SCCM nevers gives such feedback. Technically the installation will finish successfully and the software is also included by new inventories of the client. The same thing happens with uninstallation bookings.

If you close the change manually, the workflows will be finished as expected. How can we troubleshoot why no such information about installation tasks is returned by SCCM?

2016-11-09 KSN:

Applying both forms to the workflow configuration didn't change the behavior.

They've placed a test order ORD01832 / CHN02110 around 08.11.2016 15:55 in Logs for the Service 'Audacity' on Computer 'A-V10-1602012' and User 'Tanja Heller'.

I've activated debug log level and attached them to the inq.

2016-11-17 KSN:

Customer confirmed that this issue is not about bundles. Here they order single services.

2016-11-29 KSN:

Result of SQL query attached.

2016-12-05 KSN:

New Services now get succesfully provisioned and the wf completes. There are still 559 old prov. and Change Workflows pending. New logs attached.

Table1.WiDescription:
Important note:
===============
This Hotfix was created for Matrix42 Service Store 8.1.2.1712 and must not be used with other versions!
Problems which are fixed:
PRB29146: Close Change Activity Fails workflow with timeout exception
PRB29168 Service Desk on UUX blocking issues:
1. Send Email Action- > Users and Subject is not prefilled from selected Ticket

2. Journal: Journal in readonly mode in Incident Edit dialog is also readonly. But must be editable always

3. Object Picker: It is not possible to search by part of the name using '%' as in previous versions. For example find initiator by his first name

4. Feature: Automatic accept of Incident when creating it in Agent Console. Configurable in UUX Service Desk Global Settings. Disabled by default

5. Feature: Actions can be shown in Edit Dialog. (Added attribute "Show on Edit Dialog"). Action "Take Over"  is shown by default here

6. Feature: Automatic time tracking  in UUX for actions Close, Forward, Pause, Return To Role

7. Edit of incident will reset status to New

8. Feature: Actions, Widgets can be hidden to be shown in UUX. Attribute Enabled added to Action Dialog. To get changes applied - iisreset still needed

9. View in Dialog always shows English localization. Incident Edit dialog for example

10. Feature: Transfering calls from Incident and Person Preview when clicking on call icon placed near phone number

11. Journal: Problem with difficulties to write journal entries when there are already several present. You needed to scroll

12. Journal and RichTextBox: Copy/Paste of richtext with images was not working

13. Journal: Btn add was not always activate for journal when adding new

14. Feature: Service method added for Changing Deadline of Ticket

Table1.WiTitle: Introduce caching mechanism for Data Queries
Table1.WiDescription:
To improve performance of the System it is proposed to provide an option for Data Queries setup caching.

For Data Queries of type SQL Query and maybe Data Defintion allow to confgirure caching:

[ x ] Allow Caching
     Caching interval [hh:mm] (Hint: Setup the interval for updating the data in Cache.)
[ x ] Culture Invariant (Hint: Signals that the Data Query result-set contains localizable values )

On Server:
Use ICacheManager service for storing data in cache
if cache is set, return "Max-age" and "Vary: Accept-language" in resposne

[Inquiry]: T135437 - font size of 'send e-mail' action
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Schenten, Kevin
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

Hi,

how can we change the default font size for Outbound emails by the send e-mail action. It's not effected by the "C:\Program Files (x86)\Matrix42\Matrix42 Workplace Management\Web\_CSS\HtmlEditor.css" file. The font size wile editing the mail in service store correlates the value in HtmlEditor.css, but if you send the mail it will appear with font size 12 in the receivers mailbox, no matter what.

The behavior is recreateable with our test Exchange 2013 and the latest Service Store build.

It seems to not be, that the Exchange Server reformats the email. I've sended test mails from other sources which all had their original formatting.

How comes?

dev Update Data Query dialog with Caching controls
Table1.TaskDescription:
1. Extend Schema:
 PDRDataQueryClassBase.AllowCache: bool = false
 PDRDataQueryClassBase.CultureSensitive: bool = false- by default 
 PDRDataQueryClassBase.CacheInterval: int= 60 - Description: Amount of minutes the data are kept in Cache

2. Update Dialog
- if Data Query type is SQL or Data Definition enable Caching configuration attributes
- if Allow Cache is checked then "Cache Interval" and Culture Invariat is enabled
- check Report Tracking Time Wizard to use righ ontrol for Interval
- validate correct input for interval, disable intervals more then 24h

Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Konietzny, Beatrice
Found in build: 8.1.0.1651 - WPM 8.1

Hi, does anyone have an idea?

If in a bundle the “Provisioning Service” used, a service-specific form of the waiting service no longer be filled. And the customer will receive an error message when ordering (attachment: 07-warenkorb_FehlerAbsenden)

Together with Michael Abel I looked at the configuration at the customer, we could not find something wrong. Here also the logs. In our test system, I have the “Provisioning Service” also used in a bundle. Both forms are offered to me to fill. I can not reproduce the error.
The customer documents includes no specials.

Picture 01_ServiceADAccountBereitstellen shows: Target Ready Stellender Service (Created an AD account)

Picture 02_ServiceMailPostfachbestellen shows: Service with technical target “ADAcount”

Picture 03_BundleKonfiguration_Mailpostfachbestellen shows configuration Bundle

Picture 04_Portal_KonfigurationBundle shows: Representation of the bundle in the portal

Picture 05_PortalzusatzinfoADAccountbereitstellen shows: only the additional information information of the target-providing services queried

Picture 06a_Portal_WarenkorbBundleMitEinzelService shows: will be ordered individually this service, the information is retrieved and displayed

Picture 07_Warenkorb_fehlerAbsenden shows: Error message in the portal for sending the basket

2016-11-04 OHR:

Hi,

customer Rhenus has the following issue:

A license requirement with the license model "Management Datacenter | 2 CPU + ML (Full Virtualization; Mobility on SA)" is calucalating the quantity as 0.

The consumer is a physical machine and has valid and complete CPU information (2 CPUs) in its inventory. Testwise I changed the license model of the demand record to "CPU" which resulted in the correct recalculation to quantity = 2. I then changed the license model back to "Management Datacenter | 2 CPU + ML (Full Virtualization; Mobility on SA)" and the quantity changed back to 0.

I tried to reproduce this in an 8.0 test lab but the license model worked correctly there.

Please assist.

Kind regards,
Oliver

-----------

2016-12-02 OHR:

Hi Slava,

as requested.

Kind regards,
Oliver

Table1.TaskTitle: [Inquiry]: T135903 - Rhenus: License Demand Records licensed multiple times
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Hauner, Oliver
Found in build: 8.0.2.1580 - WPM2015 Update 2

2016-11-04 OHR:

Hi,

customer Rhenus has the following issue:

a couple of license demand records (currently < 10) show a very strange behaviour:

History shows that during license assignment the procedure was repeated and sometimes even within one processing round within a few seconds.
This means: LRQ status went through "New", "License Required" and "Licensed" until a license was assigned. Status switched to "New", "License Required" and "Licensed" again, leaving the LRQ with 2 Licenses!

Example: license model "Installation /w 2nd copy", 1 usage right required, 2 licenses with 1 usage right each attached and Object Details say "Missing Usage Rights = -1"

I have no explanation for this.

These records are easy to fix: reconfirm the records and after recalculation things are corrected.

Since the customer does not know how this happened and cannot be sure it does not happen again, we need to analyse what caused this.

Please assist.

Kind regards,
Oliver

We need help as soon as possible, because it is critical to customer if no emails are processed.

Thank You in advance

[Inquiry]: T132470 - inventory of hyper-v server fails for non obvious reason
Table1.TaskDescription:
Reported By: Schenten, Kevin
Found in build: 8.1.0.1651 - WPM 8.1

Hi,

the customer has issues with most of his hyper-v servers, regardless they have Server 2008 R2 or Server 2012 R2 installed. We've checked the attached 'Requirements for inventory scanning using data.pdf' to see whether the requirements are fullfilled or not and couldn't find a solution that way.

I've enabled powershell remoting on the test Server and added the the to be scanned host as to the trusted host list of the DataGateway Server and vice versa.
I've added the account that runs the scan to the remote WMI Control with full Access.
Windows Firewall has been deactivated (3rd party Firewall was still active but didn't blocked the traffic as can be seen on the attached screenshot).
The scanning account is part of the local and domain Administrators groups.
Windows Remote Management service is running.

I've installed the 3rd Party library for PowerShell which you told us to install on Server 2008 R2 Systems, which at least changed the error message in the logs and the logged answer on the firewall (before Installation there was an 'incomplete', after Installation it shows a Windows-remote-management connection).
We also tried whit the firewall deactivated, which didn't changed a thing.

The DataGateway log throws an error message regarding the hyperv module which seems to could not be loaded and asks to install .NET 3.5 or higher. Installed Version of .net is 4.5.2.

Somehow, there are a few Server that can be scanned by Hypver-V Provider. Including Server 2008 R2 and Server 2012 R2. Unfortunately I could not figure out the difference between those and the ones that fail.
